intro: Cyathula triuncinella, commonly known as the three-toothed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique cyathium inflorescence, which resembles a cup-shaped structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Cyathula triuncinella is known for its toxic milky sap, which can cause skin irritation.
